intro: Ethulia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy ethulia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Ethulia pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
